name: General Chemistry I
description: Introduction to the basic principles of chemistry including atomic and molecular structure, chemical reactions and stoichiometry, gas laws, solutions, thermochemistry, chemical bonding, and equilibrium.

name: General Chemistry II
description: Continuation of General Chemistry I with emphasis on acid-base chemistry, chemical kinetics, thermodynamics, electrochemistry, nuclear chemistry, and introduction to organic chemistry.

name: Calculus I
description: A study of limits, continuity, differentiation and integrals with basic applications.

name: General Physics I
description: An introduction to mechanics, including motion, forces, work, energy, momentum, and harmonic motion.

name: Quantum Chemistry
description: Development of the fundamental concepts and techniques of quantum mechanics. Applications to atomic and molecular structure, spectroscopy, and chemical bonding.

name: Mathematical Methods for Physical Sciences
description: Development of mathematical techniques for use in physical sciences, including vector calculus, linear algebra, ordinary and partial differential equations, and complex analysis.

name: General Physics II
description: An introduction to electricity and magnetism, including circuits, capacitance, resistance, electric fields, magnetic fields, and electromagnetic waves.

name: Statistical Thermodynamics
description: Introduction to the basic concepts of statistical mechanics, including classical and quantum statistics and their application to the thermodynamic behavior of matter.

name: Computational Chemistry
description: Introduction to the use of computers in chemistry, including molecular modeling, molecular dynamics, and quantum chemical calculations.
